original_solution_mapping.L1: Nurse Missy has 12*(1/3)=<<12*(1/3)=4>>4 special needs patients.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Special needs patients take 20% longer to serve, which means serving takes 1.2*5=6 minutes per patient.
original_solution_mapping.L4: To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take 5*8=<<5*8=40>>40 minutes.
original_solution_mapping.L5: To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take 6*4=<<6*4=24>>24 minutes.
original_solution_mapping.L6: In total, it will take 40+24=<<40+24=64>>64 minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 370.
    Returns: the total time to serve dinner to all patients.
    """
    # L1
    total_patients = 12 # 12 patients
    special_diet_fraction = Fraction(1, 3) # one-third of her patients
    special_needs_patients = total_patients * special_diet_fraction

    # L2
    standard_care_patients = total_patients - special_needs_patients

    # L3
    serving_time_standard = 5 # 5 minutes to serve each standard care patient
    special_care_increase_factor = 1.2 # increases the serving time by 20%
    serving_time_special = special_care_increase_factor * serving_time_standard

    # L4
    total_time_standard_care = serving_time_standard * standard_care_patients

    # L5
    total_time_special_care = serving_time_special * special_needs_patients

    # L6
    total_serving_time = total_time_standard_care + total_time_special_care

    # FA
    answer = total_serving_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Nurse Missy has {total_patients}*({special_diet_fraction})=<<{total_patients}*({special_diet_fraction})={special_needs_patients}>>{special_needs_patients} special needs patients.
Special needs patients take 20% longer to serve, which means serving takes {special_care_increase_factor}*{serving_time_standard}={serving_time_special} minutes per patient.

To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take {serving_time_standard}*{standard_care_patients}=<<{serving_time_standard}*{standard_care_patients}={total_time_standard_care}>>{total_time_standard_care} minutes.

To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take {serving_time_special}*{special_needs_patients}=<<{serving_time_special}*{special_needs_patients}={total_time_special_care}>>{total_time_special_care} minutes.

In total, it will take {total_time_standard_care}+{total_time_special_care}=<<{total_time_standard_care}+{total_time_special_care}={total_serving_time}>>{total_serving_time} minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Nurse Missy has 12*(1/3)=<<12*(1/3)=4>>4 special needs patients.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Special needs patients take 20% longer to serve, which means serving takes 1.2*5=6 minutes per patient.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: To serve dinner to all of her standard care patients, it will take 12*8=<<12*8=96>>96 minutes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: To serve dinner to all of her special needs patients, it will take 6*4=<<6*4=24>>24 minutes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: In total, it will take 96+24=<<96+24=120>>120 minutes to serve dinner to all of her patients.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_patients' (12) was used instead of 'serving_time_standard' (5).
